post.Title: SPARQLing RDF Repositories
post.Content:
I bet that the title is the first time anyone has ever attempted to make such a geeky play on the SPARQL acronym.

This post is to list a few handy findings I have just made that could be pursued more next year in my research:

  • Boca is an RDF repository that sits atop a database such as DB2. It sounds quite similar to the D2R server I mentioned previously.
  • SPARQL faq for anybody that desperately wants to know about SPARQL.
  • IBM Semantic Layered Research Platform and Planet Adtech: The people behind Boca.

That'll do for now.
